abstract: Statehouse Journal; Vermont Legislature re-elects, by secret ballot, Democratic Gov Peter Shumlin to his third two-year term; he received 46.4 percent of popular vote in November election, falling short of 50 percent required by state constitution to win; Republican businessman Scott Milne won 45.1 percent.
lead_paragraph: The election had to be decided by the Legislature after the front-runner, Gov. Peter Shumlin, a Democrat, failed to win 50 percent of the vote in November.
snippet: The election had to be decided by the Legislature after the front-runner, Gov. Peter Shumlin, a Democrat, failed to win 50 percent of the vote in November.

headline.main: In Vermont, Election Is Held on Nov. 4, and Governor Is Chosen on Jan. 8
headline.print_headline: In Vermont, Election Is Held on Nov. 4, and Governor Is Chosen on Jan. 8
